intro: Anemia obovata, commonly known as the broadleaf anemone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate, deeply lobed leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Anemia obovata thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
